Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "[Application] FullBackupContent is the wrong type" (#2386) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
I see that the `[Application]` attribute `FullBackupContent` member is `bool` but should be `string`:

https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/application-element#fullBackupContent

> VS bug [#723928](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/723928)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Android project options which require the NDK are no longer working in VS2019 previews" (#2652) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Install the latest VS2019 preview.
2. Ensure you have a recent NDK version installed at $(AndroidSdk)/ndk-bundle.
3. Attempt to build an Android project with AOT enabled.

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
The NDK path is resolved correctly.

### Actual Behavior
Projects which require the NDK fail to build.

### Version Information
https://gist.github.com/pjcollins/28034d1b01aa5e7893f007f2d3d846cc

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Bump to xamarin/xamarin-android-tools/dc00a398" (#2660) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Closed issue "Unable to deploy to device using XA 9.1.103.x. Fails with "The "Environments" parameter is not supported by the "BuildApk" task."" (#2635) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Install XA 9.1.103.8 and VS for Mac 8.0.0.1522 or any 8.0 version
2. Create a new Android project
3. Select a device and hit Start Debugging

### Expected Behavior

Project is build and deployed to device and starts running

### Actual Behavior

Deploying to Device fails with

```
error MSB4064: The "Environments" parameter is not supported by the "BuildApk" task. Verify the parameter exists on the task, and it is a settable public instance property.
error MSB4063: The "BuildApk" task could not be initialized with its input parameters. 
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Application] FullBackupContent is the wrong type" (#2386) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
I see that the `[Application]` attribute `FullBackupContent` member is `bool` but should be `string`:

https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/application-element#fullBackupContent

> VS bug [#723928](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/723928)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Open assemblies with Mono.Cecil less, by using item metadata" (#2206) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
As described [here](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/wiki/Build-Performance-Ideas#resolvelibraryprojectimports-and-getadditionalresourcesfromassemblies).

We could have a task that runs earlier that "classifies" assemblies with MSBuild item metadata:
- `HasNativeLibraries`
- `HasEmbeddedJars`
- `HasLibraryProjects`
- `HasAdditionalResources`

The idea then, is we could pass in a LOT less assemblies to these MSBuild tasks:
- `ResolveLibraryProjectImports`
- `GetAdditionalResourcesFromAssemblies`
- `BuildApks` (the `EmbeddedNativeLibraryAssemblies` property)

Further research is needed to see if we can do the same treatment with `ResolveAssemblies` and other tasks that happen _after_ `Compile`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "App not refreshing on simulator when FastDev is disabled" (#1546) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open CrossDebuggingSample (I can share a link privately)
2. Set Configuration to Debug-Automatic
3. Run App
4. Modify code (I commented the first part of MainActivity.cs)
5. Run again

### Expected Behavior
App will be modified on the device, commented code will not run.

### Actual Behavior
Commented code is still there and running. If you set a breakpoint on the base.OnCreate() and then step over it, you'll notice the next executed line is on a comment.

### Version Information
This is happening on master.

### Log File
Build log on Run: https://gist.github.com/joj/040631a66b0b11760e8171114425dd4a

> VS bug [#660388](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/660388)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Enhancement][Core] ListView should report index of item on all events" (#4431) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

All `EventArgs` classes that are invoked by the `ListView` now report the corresponding index of the item.

### Issues Resolved ### 
<!-- Please use the format "fixes #xxxx" for each issue this PR addresses -->

- fixes #2811

### API Changes ###

Added:
 - int ItemTappedEventArgs.ItemIndex { get; private set; }
 - int SelectedItemChangedEventArgs.SelectedItemIndex { get; private set; }
 - int ItemVisibilityEventArgs.ItemIndex { get; private set; }

Changed:
 - ctor: ItemTappedEventArgs(object group, object item) => ItemTappedEventArgs(object group, object item, int itemIndex)
 - ctor: ItemVisibilityEventArgs(object item) => ItemVisibilityEventArgs(object item, int itemIndex)
 - ctor: SelectedItemChangedEventArgs(object selectedItem) => SelectedItemChangedEventArgs(object selectedItem, int selectedItemIndex)
 
### Platforms Affected ### 
<!-- Please list all platforms affected by these changes -->

- Core/XAML (all platforms)

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###
<!-- Describe any changes that may change how a user's app behaves or appears when upgrading to this version of the codebase. -->

None

### Before/After Screenshots ### 
<!-- If possible, take a screenshot of your test case before these changes were made and another screenshot after the changes were made to show possible visual changes. -->

Not applicable

### Testing Procedure ###
<!-- Please list the steps that should be taken to properly test these changes on each relevant platform. If you were unable to test these changes yourself on any or all platforms, please let us know. Also, if you are able to attach a video of your test run, you will be our personal hero. -->

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [x] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ListView should report index of item on all events" (#2811) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
## Summary
On `ListView`, add a `SelectedIndex` property. Also, add `Index` (of item) property to `ItemTappedEventArgs`, `SelectedItemChangedEventArgs` and `ItemVisibilityEventArgs`, used by `ItemTapped`,  `ItemSelected`, `ItemAppearing` and `ItemDisappearing` respectively.

## Intended Use Case
Today we need to call `IndexOf(item)` to get the index in the list, which is inefficient for most collection types. This can be avoided since the listview must track this information already.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "ArgumentNullException when using ContentView" (#5081) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
If you set the content of the ShellContent tag to be a ContentView the InitializeComponent method throws an ArgumentNullException. An exception is the correct behavior as the content should be ContentPage, not ContentView. However, the exception is incorrect. It should through an exception complaining about the type of content.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new shell application
2. Have content point to a ContentView
3. Run Application

### Expected Behavior
Throw exception stating that ContentView is not a supported content type.

### Actual Behavior
Throws an ArgumentNullException

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 4.0.0.94569-pre3
- Last known good version:
- IDE: Visual Studio for Mac v8.0 Preview (8.0 build 869)
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - iOS:  all versions
  - Android: all versions

### Reproduction Link

https://github.com/rsatter/bailassistant

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[iOS] Move Material iOS components to a separate nuget" (#5026) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Move material iOS renderers out to a separate dll and added a required an init call from the iOS platform. The effect of this is that if you don't want to use material components then the material Nuget dll and the material renderers dll won't get included into the app package. If the user forgets the init call then they should see a warning about needing to add the Init call for material

### Issues Resolved ### 

- fixes #5020

### API Changes ###

Added required call to enable material on ios
```C#
FormsMaterial.Init()
```

Added:
 - FormsMaterial.Init()

### Platforms Affected ### 
<!-- Please list all platforms affected by these changes -->

- Core/XAML (all platforms)
- iOS

### Testing Procedure ###
- Remove the FormsMaterial.Init() call from the app delegate on control gallery
- verify that application still runs and material related dlls don't get added into the project

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [x] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[msbuild] Fixes Microsoft.NET.Build.Extensions.Tasks.dll path" (#5492) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Replaces the hardcoded path to Microsoft.NET.Build.Extensions.Tasks.dll by the MicrosoftNETBuildExtensionsTasksAssembly property. The assembly is in a different location in dev16.

Also removed the old condition that only applied to VS 2015 and early builds of 2017 where the assembly did not exist.

Bug 778800 - Certain iOS projects are failing to build against dev16 seemingly due to a netstandard resolution issue
Fixes https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/778800

Events.RelatedBody:
All types now have availability annotations for macOS 10.14.4, however
there's no headers (yet?) for ClassKit in the macOS SDK that ships with
Xcode 10.2 beta 1.
